Tallahassee, FL

Info

OpenHack Tallahassee: Code together, on anything, in Tally! Sign Up Here

We’re a group of developers, tinkerers, programmers, designers, students, professionals….and more. Tallahassee has a young, intelligent and vibrant culture. Our meetups should be about seeing what comes out of that culture when a bunch of local hackers get together.

Everyone is welcome. All ages and experience levels.

OpenHackTLH is coordinated by me :-) Frank
Have any questions? Want to help out? Feel free to get in touch.

  • For a rundown on the OpenHack basics - read this


Sign Up

Signing up is easy.
Just register for our newsletter (no spam; pinky swear) and be notified of upcoming hacks.

Register Here

@OpenHackTLH

Meetups

OpenHack6


The next meetup will be Friday 8/2 @ 7pm.
In FSU’s Love Building Rm. 151.

General Info:

  • If you come with an idea to pitch make sure to bring any materials you’ll need.
  • If you come to code, bring a laptop
  • We’ll do our best to make sure the wifi is strong
  • Refreshments may occasionally be provided


Past meetups


OpenHack5.5

OpenHackTLH’s Fifth and a Half Meetup

  • 4 people
  • held Friday 7/19
  • at FSU’s Love Building Rm. 151.

Links:
AdvizApp Repo
AdvizApp Trello Board
Scraping Strategy

Impromptu meeting to discuss strategy for scraping course data for AdvizApp. More info is available at the AdvizApp Trello Board.




OpenHack5

OpenHackTLH’s Fifth Meetup

  • 4 people
  • held Friday 7/12
  • at FSU’s Love Building Rm. 151.

Links:
AdvizApp Repo
Django Tutorial

We started AdvizApp, a Django web app to help students plan their schedules and course selections.

  • 5 people
  • held Friday 6/21
  • at FSU’s Love Building Rm. 151.

Links: RaspBerryPi

We looked at the RaspBerryPi… next time I’ll make sure they have some things to do ;)




OpenHack3

OpenHackTLH’s Third Meetup

  • 6 people
  • held Friday 5/31
  • at FSU’s Love Building Rm. 151.

Links:
Why use pip and virtualenv
Intro to pip and virtualenv
git repo for workshop

We looked at methods for crawling and scraping data from websites using Python and BeautifulSoup4




OpenHack2

OpenHackTLH’s Second Meetup

  • 6 people
  • held Friday 5/17
  • at All Saints Cafe

We had a couple impromptu workshops on git and SQL injection. We started a project that will eventually be an FSU hashtag aggregator. And someone offered up their truck as a project… next time!




OpenHack1

The The First Meetup! had a great turnout…

  • 15 people
  • held Friday 4/12
  • at FSU, Love Building Rm. 151.
  • Made in Buffalo, NY.
  • Follow @OpenHack for announcements.
  • Inspired by many BostonRB hack nights.
  • This page is open source.
